lead_paragraph: Air-quality regulators in California have proposed rules that are tougher than Federal pollution standards to limit emissions from personal watercraft and motorboats. The rules proposed by the state's Air Resources Board would force manufacturers to make cleaner engines for personal watercraft, like Jet Skis, and motorboats.
abstract: Air-quality regulators in California propose rules that are tougher than Federal pollution standards to limit emissions from personal watercraft and motorboats; Bill Rush, spokesman for group representing recreational boat owners, criticizes proposed regulations, saying they would make boat engines too expensive and hurt state's $11 billion boating and related industries (M)

headline.main: California Seeks New Limits on Boat Pollution
